Merging Files Manually

When you use the View Comparison utility, files are a special case because you can merge both the file revision’s properties and its contents.

If a file is locked by another user in the view to which you are merging, the application does not create a new revision using the merged file. You should ask users to unlock their files or break their file locks before performing the merge.

Conflicts are defined as file properties or lines of text that have changed in both text files (or both revisions of the same text file). In this situation, the View Comparison utility and Visual Merge cannot automatically determine what changes to retain in the merged file, so you will have to make these changes manually.

To merge two files:

  1. Open the view to be used as the source.

  2. Click View > Compare/Merge to select the view that will serve as the target.

  3. Select the appropriate tab from the lower pane.

  4. Select one or more items from the item pane. At least one item must have an icon indicating that it requires the type of merge you want to perform (to source or to target).

  5. From the Item or context menu, select Merge Items > To Source or Merge Items > To Target. The <item> Merge dialog opens. This dialog displays four columns that show:

    • Names of the properties.

    • Values of the properties in the source folder or item.

    • Values of the properties in the target folder or item.

    • Suggested merged properties. The merge process compares the source and target properties.

      • If a property’s value is the same in both items, the value appears in the Merged column. (Either no changes have taken place or both the source and target have changed in identical ways.)

      • If a property’s value is different in both items, the application displays the row in boldface type and puts a value in the Merged column based on the following principles:

    If the values for a given property were the same at the time of the last recorded merge and only one has changed since, the changed value appears by default in the Merged column. In all other cases, the value that appears by default in the Merged column is the value of the property in the view to which you are merging.

  6. Review the properties in boldface type, if any. These are the properties that are different

  7. To change the value in the Merged column to the value that appears in the From or To column:

    1. Select the property.

    2. Click Apply from or Apply to. Apply from places the value in the From column in the Merged column, while Apply to places the value in the To column in the Merged column.

      3. The File Merge dialog displays the properties for both files and the suggested merged properties if they differ. (If there are no merge conflicts to be resolved, this dialog does not appear.)

  8. Do one of the following if you intend to merge the contents of the source and target files:

    • Select the Save merged item contents to server check box to check in the file as part of the merge process. (Your most recent setting for the Save merged item contents to server check box will become a personal option and be stored in starteam-client-options.xml.)

    • Clear the Save merged item contents to server check box to save the file in the working folder for the Merge To location. This allows you to test the merged file before checking it in manually.

  9. Do one of the following:

    • Select the Record merge check box so that the application records the revision of the corresponding item in the other view involved in this merge. If you select this check box and track merges, a merge in the current direction (source or target) cannot be performed until the corresponding item changes. Thus, two corresponding items may be different but not need a merge. If you are not tracking merges, the application will indicate that two corresponding items that are different need to be merged.

    • Clear the Record merge check box if you do not want to record this merge. If you track merges but do not record this merge, this pair of items will continue to be available for a merge in this direction after the merge is complete.

  10. Do one of the following to save the merged folder or item properties as a revision in the source or target.

    • Click OK to save the merged file properties to the source or the target view and exit the dialog.

    • Click Apply to save the merged file properties to the source or target view and remain in the dialog.

    • Click Merge Contents to merge the contents of the two files.
